feed.title: Bits of experience
feed.subtitle: Experienced software engineer, who loves building things more than he cares if you'll use them.

entry.title: Kraken trades
entry.content:
I’m one of those people. I shifted crypto around while it was bubbling.

Now that things are cooling down, I wondered what the aftermath was. It turns out that I generated too many moves to study manually. The website (kraken.com) doesn’t have many tools to help me. Luckily, it’s just data, and I’m a programmer. I should be able to create whatever view I want of it.

A few hours late, I had a way to calculate the performance of each individual buying event. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IrQPB3R0VU0iIS24ycE-l2yPN3PtRlpbvbgzIQbPJDA/edit?usp=sharing

I know people who traded and can’t code… yikes. And you’re welcome.
entry.summary: I’m one of those people. I shifted crypto around while it was bubbling.
